name_japanese: 知ったかぶりカイツブリ
description:
A Shiga prefecture promotional anime for Lake Biwa. The Lake Biwa Otsu Prince Hotel has a mascot called Prince Nio (named after the hotel 'Prince' and 'Nio' after the port the hotel is located on). 

The mascot was also used for a local news program, real estate commercials, cheering on the local schools' sport events, and other promotional needs for the region under Biwako Broadcasting and Fujigumi's copyright stake in the mascot.

They released a series of family-friendly sing-a-long CDs and animated music video DVDs.

name_japanese: 静かなるドン Yakuza Side Story
description:
This manga depicts the life of Shizuya Kondou, a man who designs underwear by day and is "don" of a gang at night.

(Source: ANN)

name_japanese: ショボクジラ・チビコブラ
description: Music video for the song Shobo Kujira Chibi Cobra by NHK Tokyo Jidou Gasshoudan that was featured on NHK's Minna no Uta program. The video was animated by Tatsuji Kurahashi.

name_japanese: ショッキングブラック
description: Music video by AC-bu for the song SHOCKING BLACK by Japanese hip-hop group Zamagi that was included on their first single.
TV commercial for HYPONeX Japan's plant stock solution, which acts as both a fertilizer and pesticide.

name_japanese: シューティング・ヒーロー
description: A music video for the song "Shooting Hero" by Duke Aces. Aired as part of NHK's Minna no Uta program from April to May 1986.

name_english: Sho is Flying in the Sky
description: An anime version of Ikkei Makina's horror novel of the same name. It aired at the same time as the live-action adaptation.

name_japanese: 小学生の誘拐防止　ユミちゃんあぶないよ
description: A video for kids shown in japanese schools to prevent against kid abduction.
A slapstick OVA featuring super deformed members of the Shinsengumi members

name_japanese: 少女ファイト 野良犬たちのおでかけ
description:
The story follows Neri Ooishi, a high school girl who is a talented volleyball player. She once was the captain of an elementary school team that went all the way to the national tournament. However, she spent three years as an alternate at a junior high school renowned for its volleyball program. Now she is in high school with new teammates, and she gets a chance to prove herself again. 

The sixth manga volume will have a "special edition" that will ship with the anime DVD on October 23. Nihonbashi herself is writing the script for the anime, and Prodution I.G is animating it.

name_japanese: 少女☆歌劇 レヴュースタァライト ロンド・ロンド・ロンド
description: Compilation film of Shoujo☆Kageki Revue Starlight.

name_japanese: 消火ロボゼウレス　ファイアドラゴンを倒せ！
description: A fire safety anime with a sci-fi mecha flare. When an ocarina is blown, the mecha Zeres arrives to extinguish the flames.

name_japanese: 世界名作劇場・完結版 小公子セディ
description: A summary of the Shoukoushi Cedie full series aired as a TV specials.
Music video for the song "Shounen" by Otogivanashi (おとぎ話) from their 2015 album "Culture Club." Directed by Satoshi Jimbo.
After moving to a new town, a young boy comes across a lone baby seal. They become fast friends and enjoy everyday life together.

The anime is based on the 4-panel comic strip drawn by Morishita Hiromi and published in Young Jump. The story describes the daily life of Ashibe (an elementary school boy) and his family and friends, including a pet white sea lion.
Sequel to Shounen Ashibe
A compilation film featuring content from the second Shounen Ashibe series.

name_japanese: 少年アシベ 安全教育アニメ
description: A pair of educational films about emergency protocols and traffic safety, respectively.
An educational anime about the Pacific War. Based on the autobiographical best selling work by Kappa Senoo.

name_japanese: 少年むくはとじゅう物語
description: An educational film that follows the famous Japanese writer Muku Hatojuu in his boyhood as he gets bullied.

Kidnapped and rescued by a Ninja, Fujimaru has mastered martial arts over the years. Now he sets off on a journey to find his mother and also locate an old tome containing secret martial arts techniques.

(Source: AniDB)

name_japanese: 少年忍者風のフジ丸 謎のアラビヤ人形
description:
Kidnapped and rescued by a Ninja, Fujimaru has mastered martial arts over the years. Now he sets off on a journey to find his mother and also locate an old tome containing secret martial arts techniques.

(Source: AniDB)
Based on L. Frank Baum' novel: The Life and Adventures of Santa Claus.

name_japanese: CM 小学館 少年サンデー「オールスター総出演」編
description: Television commercial for Shounen Sunday magazine's 40th anniversary featuring characters from Detective Conan, InuYasha, H2, Dan Doh!!, ARMS, Karakuri Circus, and Flame of Rekka.

name_japanese: 少年と魔法のロボット
description:
A boy who loves to music but cannot sing in front of others receives an robot from a scientist. He teaches the robot music and singing so it can perform in his stead. Magically, it becomes its own person.

The music video represents how the Vocaloid franchise has given voice to many people who are too scared or too muddled in their own talents to sing on behalf of the music they created. And while it is a computer software, it's thanks to those peoples' creations that the Vocaloids themselves have gone on to have their own self-standing personas.

A historical tale of the early life of Tokugawa Ieyasu, who would eventually become shogun and establish the Edo Period in Japan.

(Source: AniDB)

Baseball coach Hoshiyama offers a chance to turn professional to Katsumi Kunimasa, a star member of the student squad that won the summer tournament. The young girl becomes a star pitcher for the Chunchi Dragons (conveniently, the team her father owns), and, after a year of triumphs, she leads them to victory in the national championships at the legendary Koshien Stadium. Based on the manga by Noriko Umeda, this anime may be compared to the other girl-playing baseball story "Song of the Baseball Enthusiasts". 

The Dragons team members are all based on the real-life team, though their opponents are  fictional. At the time, the real-life Hoshiyama was a commentator, but fact was eventually true to fiction and he became the manager for the real-life Dragons. 

(Source: The Anime Encyclopedia)

name_japanese: 将太の寿司 心にひびくシャリの味
description: Shouta no Sushi is about a young boy who dreams of being a sushi chef just like his father. The anime steps away from the competitive nature of the manga and focuses on self-sufficiency and policy issues of agriculture, forestry, and fisheries in Japan in order to educate the population (as it was funded by the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries) using the popular franchise as a proxy.

name_japanese: 昭和アホ草紙あかぬけ一番！
description:
Koujirou moves to Tokyo from Japan's northernmost island of Hokkaido and insists on bringing his favorite horse, Hikarikin, with him. The alien king Rel arrives from planet Wedelun and gives him a belt that will allow him to transform into a Miracle Hero and to protect the world from alien menaces. He is more interested, however, in impressing the pretty Yuka, though his rival, Michinari, wants her for himself.

(Source: The Anime Encyclopedia)

Last century, Shi Dali was sealed for 100 years, but he accidentally discovered Qingqing, the celestial nine tails fox. He started his path to become Chief Soul Master, to find out the mistery of his origin and to protect the world.

(Source: themoviedb)
Music video for the single Showtime by Japanese rock band DATS.
Marie Yasui's graduation film.
No synopsis information has been added to this title. Help improve our database by adding a synopsis here.

In the year 2200, a new Cold War between two forces is set to end with a peace treaty. However, one side is hiding a dark secret, which results in numerous tragedies in the following months. In the wake of a crisis, a paramilitary team is founded to steal information at the center of the conflict.
Sugawara-san commissioned a video to be shown at her wedding about her and her husband about their love journey.
Based on a Yakuza drama manga by Kawabe Yuu and Yamaguchi Masato.
An educational film showing the importance of perusing dreams and the depression that occurs when parents force their children's careers into what they want rather than what the child wants.
Music video of Shuuen no Shiori published originally online on Niconico, whose song was included in Shuuen –Re:write- CD.
An educational film about abstract thought.
Shuukan Shimakou is about a life of a Japanese white-collar worker salaryman, Shima Kosaku.
Preview episode aired online.

name_japanese: 週刊ストーリーランド
genres: Slice of Life, Comedy, Drama, Seinen
description:
This was an anthology program containing several different anime each week along with some non-animated segments. Several of the animated films were short series including: Nazo no Rouba [謎の老婆] (tvss), Meibugyou Bun-san [名奉行・文さん], Jo Keibu Jinguuji Youko [女警部・神宮寺葉子], Remon Suzumori's Soudanjo [鈴森なんでも相談所].

(Source: animated-divots.net)
Music video directed by Kousuke Sugimoto for the song Shuuseki Life by Handsome Kenya.

genres: Action, Adventure, Fantasy, Historical, Martial Arts, Military, Mystery
description: No synopsis information has been added to this title. Help improve our database by adding a synopsis here.
Recap episode of Si Ling Bianma: Zhi Shijie Caozong Zhe that aired between episode 10 and 11.
A music video for BACK DROP BOMB's song "Sigh".
Music video by Tarafu Otani for the song sign by Japanese idol unit amiinA from their second album "Discovery".

name_japanese: シルクロード少年 ユート
description:
When a boy Yuto visits Qinghai in China, he is involved in the battle between time-travelers, and he is sent to the Silk Road in the past. They are looking for a mysterious treasure, the statue of Yuki Daruma Taishi, which is said to make miracles. Seeing historical events and encountering historical persons, such as Yang Guifei and Xuanzang, he will learn many thinks. Whether will he be able to go back to today?

(Source: AnimeNfo)

name_japanese: シルクロード少年 ユート 総集編
description: Recap episode of Silk Road Shounen Yuuto that took place between episode 16 and 17. The episode title is a homage to the famous novel Toki wo Kakeru Shoujo.
